results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: From my point of view
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Uses sequences showing children from the ages of two and a half to five and a half with an adult in order to analyse the ways in which a child’s egocentrism affects the ability to see another person’s point of view. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Changes
results.creator_credit: Karin Altmann, Kent Chadwick, Filmpartnership and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film aims to promote a greater understanding of the changes which are taking place in the workforce. It shows women working in non-traditional female occupations such as commercial photography, bank manager, plumber, jockey, explosives technician and stage manager, and attempts to encourage young women to consider a broader range of jobs than those commonly regarded as suitable for women. In 1979 women represented 36% of the workforce and 43% of all women were in paid employment but research showed that women tended to be concentrated in a narrower spectrum of occupations than men, thereby limiting their opportunities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Petronella
results.brief_description: An animated fairytale about a princess, who because she is an only child, must perform the traditionally princely duty pf rescuing a princess. Instead she rescues a prince.

results.title: Surrealism and Dada
results.brief_description: A film about the radical attack surrealism and Dada wrought on the familiar and traditional art values of the past. Through the perceptive choice of paintings and sculptures from the work of de Chirico, Duchamp, Man Ray, Ernst, Miro, Magritte, Dali, Klee and others, we become exposed to the philosophy, poetry and politics of these fascinating art movements. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Pork: the meal with a squeal
results.brief_description: This work focuses on the world distribution of pigs. Also covers the breeds of pigs, farming pigs, different sections for different meats, and meatless by-products such as brush bristle, insulin, cortisone, and thyroid extract.

results.title: Poetry for fun: trulier coolier
results.brief_description: This film features eight poems, chosen by children and dealing with what children do, what they think about, and how they feel about their world. Included are animated cartoons, giant puppets, creative photography and music. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Making baskets: an art adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie and Easy Street Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a young woman and three elmentary grade students making baskets from a variety of materials including leaves, pine needles, rope and yarn. Demonstrates in detail each step of cording, wrapping, coiling and stitching. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Israel: the 20th century miracle
results.creator_credit: Bob Bailey Studios and R and H Media Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the tiny country of Israel has developed the most efficient and advanced techniques of food production in the world, under the most adverse conditions. Also highlights kibbutz and desert lifestyles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Bailey Studios and R and H Media Productions
